wikipedia_page.main:
Lawrence Seymour Goodman (24 September 1920 – 18 July 2021) was a British airman and bomber pilot, who served in World War II. He was the last surviving wartime pilot of the No. 617 Squadron RAF (a.k.a. the Dambusters) which carried out Operation Chastise, although he did not join the squadron until after the operation.
He completed 30 operations before the cessation of hostilities in May 1945. He then served with Transport Command. He was awarded the Légion d’honneur in 2016.

response: **Lawrence Seymour Goodman, bomber pilot (No. 617 Squadron RAF) (b. 1920).
*Lawrence Seymour Goodman, 100, British bomber pilot (No. 617 Squadron RAF).Everyone at Key.Aero was saddened to hear the news that Squadron Leader Lawrence ‘Benny’ Goodman has died at the age of 100
